title: Katie Holmes goes on mother-daughter date after split from Jamie Foxx
text:
Katie and her mum spent a glamorous evening out together (Picture: Rex Features)

Katie Holmes may be newly single but her plus ones aren’t going unfilled – she took her mum with her to the American Ballet Theater opening gala and it was just the cutest.

The Logan Lucky star, 40, was joined by her mother, Kathleen Holmes as they headed to the gala night in New York on Wednesday.

The pair were seen cuddling up as they posed for photos at the event’s photography area, and enjoyed a lavish dinner with the other guests.

When it came to leave, Katie made sure Kathleen didn’t get rained on by holding a giant golf umbrella over the pair of them as she opened the car door for her mother.

Katie and Kathleen are big fans of the ballet, and the All We Had director took her mother as her guest back in May, too.

Other guests on the night included singer Tony Bennett, Chris Brown’s ex Karrueche Tran and Olivia Palermo.

It comes just weeks after Katie was said to have split from Jamie Foxx in August, after secretly dating out of the public eye for the past six years.

Katie made sure Kathleen didn’t get wet as they headed to the car (Picture: Splash News)

This is definitely one to get framed for the mantelpiece, Katie (Picture: Getty Images)

Rumours soon started of romances between Katie and Liam Hemsworth following his split from Miley Cyrus and Jamie and aspiring singer Sela Vave after they were spotted holding hands, but both proved to be false.

Katie was previously married to Tom Cruise from 2006 until filing for divorce in 2012, and the couple share 13-year-old daughter Suri Cruise.

While Katie joined the Church of Scientology during the relationship, she went back to Catholicism after the couple split, and gained full custody of Suri.

Tom, meanwhile, has two adopted children with his ex, Nicole Kidman, who remained with him as Scientologists, with Nicole saying: ‘They have made the choice to be Scientologists and as a mother, it’s my job to love them.’
